body_html: @fmassa The env variable in the THNN or TH module in that level is used to test both the code paths with or without openmp but not to tune the appropriate openmp threshold. If pytorch wants to control the openmp more finely, maybe it provides a macro table to look up. It is a trival job to tune the operations in THNN and TH modules in consideration of different CPU platforms. We could design a scripts to help us do that work if pytorch thinks it's necessary.
body_text: @fmassa The env variable in the THNN or TH module in that level is used to test both the code paths with or without openmp but not to tune the appropriate openmp threshold. If pytorch wants to control the openmp more finely, maybe it provides a macro table to look up. It is a trival job to tune the operations  in THNN and TH  modules in consideration of different CPU platforms. We could design a scripts to help us do that work if pytorch thinks it's necessary.
body: @fmassa The env variable in the `THNN` or `TH` module in that level is used to test both the code paths with or without openmp but not to tune the appropriate openmp threshold. If pytorch wants to control the openmp more finely, maybe it provides a macro table to look up. It is a trival job to tune the operations  in `THNN` and `TH`  modules in consideration of different CPU platforms. We could design a scripts to help us do that work if pytorch thinks it's necessary.
